availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Bishop (Pendleton County, Kentucky, teacher, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, teacher, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native. School teacher in Pendleton County, Kentucky in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863. Served in the 18th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a quartermaster sergeant from October 1861 to March 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 688.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Pendleton County, KY, July 20, 1863, p. 49, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War; Series Number: M123; Record Group Title: Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs; Record Group Number: 15; Pendleton County, Falmouth, Kentucky, p. 6.
